meanings.sent1: She is inaugurating a new project at work tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: The mayor will be inaugurating the new library next week.
meanings.sent3: Inaugurating a game night with friends brought laughter and fun.
meanings.sent4: The sunrise inaugurating a new day filled the sky with colors.
meanings.sent5: Inaugurating a garden with fresh flowers made the backyard beautiful.

meanings.definition: Mark the beginning of (an event or activity)
meanings.sent1: The ringing bell inaugurated the school assembly.
meanings.sent2: Fireworks will be inaugurating the festival tonight.
meanings.sent3: Inaugurating the dance party with a silly dance move made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The first snowfall inaugurated the start of winter.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the trumpet inaugurating the race echoed through the stadium.

meanings.sent1: The judge will be inaugurating the new president next week.
meanings.sent2: The ceremony will be inaugurating the new prime minister.
meanings.sent3: Inaugurating the class pet as the new leader brought smiles to the students.
meanings.sent4: The crowning moment inaugurating the king was filled with grandeur.
meanings.sent5: Inaugurating the captain of the team boosted morale among the players.
